title: How to Install Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas

steps.title: Open Steam.
steps.content: Open Steam. Click or double-click the Steam app icon, which resembles the Steam logo. Doing so will open your Steam home page if you're logged into your Steam account. If you aren't signed into Steam, enter your email address (or username) and password before proceeding.

steps.title: Click the STORE tab.
steps.content: Click the STORE tab. It's in the upper-left side of the Steam window. This will bring up the in-Steam web browser.

steps.title: Click the search box.
steps.content: Click the search box. This option is in the upper-right side of the window.

steps.title: Search for Grand Theft Auto.
steps.content: Search for Grand Theft Auto. Type in grand theft auto to prompt a list of matching games to appear.

steps.title: Click Grand Theft Auto San Andreas.
steps.content: Click Grand Theft Auto San Andreas . It's in the drop-down list of matching games.

steps.title: Enter your date of birth.
steps.content: Enter your date of birth. Click the "Day" text field and select a day, then repeat for the "Month" and "Year" text fields. If the Grand Theft Auto page opens automatically, skip this step and the next one.

steps.title: Click View Page.
steps.content: Click View Page . This is below the date of birth section. Doing so will open the Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas page.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Add to Cart.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Add to Cart . It's to the right of the "Buy Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas" heading.

steps.title: Click Purchase for myself.
steps.content: Click Purchase for myself . This green button is in the middle of the page.

steps.title: Enter your payment information if necessary.
steps.content: Enter your payment information if necessary. If asked to enter your card's number, name, and other information, do so before proceeding. If Steam remembers your payment information, skip this step.

steps.title: Click Continue.
steps.content: Click Continue . It's at the bottom of the page. You may have to scroll down to see this option.

steps.title: Check the "I agree" box.
steps.content: Check the "I agree" box. You'll find it near the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Click Purchase.
steps.content: Click Purchase . It's at the bottom of the page. Doing so will buy Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas and proceed to download it. The amount of time GTA: SA takes to download will vary depending on your Internet speed.

steps.title: Play GTA San Andreas.
steps.content: Play GTA San Andreas. Once GTA: San Andreas finishes downloading onto your Windows or Mac computer, you can play it by double-clicking its app icon, or via Steam by doing the following: Select the LIBRARY tab. Click Games in the drop-down menu. Click Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas in the left-hand column. Click PLAY in the main Library window.

steps.title: Make sure you're on a Windows computer.
steps.content: Make sure you're on a Windows computer. While the remastered version of Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is available for both Windows and Mac computers, you cannot play the original version of GTA: San Andreas on a Mac. Your computer must also have a CD drive.

steps.title: Insert the San Andreas CD into your computer.
steps.content: Insert the San Andreas CD into your computer. The CD should go label side up in your computer's CD tray.

steps.title: Open This PC.
steps.content: Open This PC. Click Start in the bottom-left corner of the screen, type in this pc , and click This PC to do so. If you're not using Windows 10, This PC will be entitled My Computer . As such, you'll type my computer into Start.

steps.title: Right-click the GTA CD's name.
steps.content: Right-click the GTA CD's name. It's in the "Devices and drives" section of the This PC window. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . This is in the drop-down menu. The CD's folder will open.

steps.title: Click once the setup file.
steps.content: Click once the setup file. The setup file has an ".exe" (EXE) extension on it, and will likely be named something like "setup". Clicking it once selects it.

steps.title: Right-click the setup file.
steps.content: Right-click the setup file. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu for the file. Doing this without first clicking once the file will result in a different drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Properties.
steps.content: Click Properties . It's in the drop-down menu. Doing so opens the Properties window.

steps.title: Click the Compatibility tab.
steps.content: Click the Compatibility tab. This is at the top of the Properties window.

steps.title: Check the "Run this program in compatibility mode for" box.
steps.content: Check the "Run this program in compatibility mode for" box. It's in the middle of the window.

steps.title: Click the drop-down box.
steps.content: Click the drop-down box. This is below the box you just checked. Clicking it prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Windows XP (Service Pack 3).
steps.content: Click Windows XP (Service Pack 3) . It's in the drop-down menu. Enabling this option will ensure that Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas installs using settings for Windows XP (the original operating system on which GTA: SA was installed) rather than attempting to use your Windows 7, 8, or 10 settings.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . It's at the bottom of the window. This will save your settings and close the Properties window.

steps.title: Double-click the setup file.
steps.content: Double-click the setup file. Doing so launches the setup window.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen installation prompts.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen installation prompts. These prompts may differ or appear in a different order, but in most cases you'll do the following: Agree to the terms of installation. Click Next . Enter the activation code found on the CD case. Click Next . Check the "Complete" box. Click Next . Click Install .

steps.title: Play GTA San Andreas.
steps.content: Play GTA San Andreas. Once GTA: San Andreas finishes installing, you'll eject the current disc and insert the disc labeled "Play" into your computer. GTA: San Andreas should then begin running. You may have to run the "Play" disc's EXE file in compatibility mode for this to work. You can do so by editing the Compatibility tab the same way you did for the first disc. Whenever the San Andreas "Play" disc is in your computer, double-clicking the GTA: San Andreas desktop shortcut will prompt it to begin running.

steps.title: Open the Xbox One Store tab.
steps.content: Open the Xbox One Store tab. On the Xbox One's home screen, press the RB button four times to select the Store tab.

steps.title: Select Search.
steps.content: Select Search . Scroll down to highlight this option, then press A . Doing so opens the Store's search bar.

steps.title: Search for Grand Theft Auto San Andreas.
steps.content: Search for Grand Theft Auto San Andreas. Type in grand theft auto san andreas . This should cause only the San Andreas game to display.

steps.title: Select GTA San Andreas.
steps.content: Select GTA San Andreas. It's the Xbox 360-styled game icon at the top of the screen. Selecting it causes its page to open.

steps.title: Select See Price.
steps.content: Select See Price . This option is on the far-right side of the screen.

steps.title: Select Continue.
steps.content: Select Continue . It's at the bottom of the price window. Under normal circumstances, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas goes for $14.99. This price may differ depending on your location and any ongoing promotions.

steps.title: Select Confirm when prompted.
steps.content: Select Confirm when prompted. Doing so will purchase GTA: San Andreas using your Xbox One's primary payment method and cause the game to begin downloading. If asked, enter your payment details before this step.

steps.title: Play GTA San Andreas.
steps.content: Play GTA San Andreas. Once San Andreas finishes downloading onto your Xbox One, you can play it by doing the following: Select My games & apps . Select the Games tab. Select Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas .

steps.title: Open the PlayStation Store.
steps.content: Open the PlayStation Store. On the PlayStation 4 home screen, scroll left to select the PlayStation Store tile and press X . If prompted to update, select Update Now , select Next , select Update , and wait for the system update to finish installing.

steps.title: Select Search.
steps.content: Select Search . It's at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Search for Grand Theft Auto.
steps.content: Search for Grand Theft Auto. Type in grand theft auto and wait for related games to appear on the right side of the screen.

steps.title: Select Grand Theft Auto San Andreas.
steps.content: Select Grand Theft Auto San Andreas . It's on the right side of the screen. This will open the Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas page.

steps.title: Select Add to Cart.
steps.content: Select Add to Cart . This option is in the upper-left side of the screen.

steps.title: Select Proceed to Checkout.
steps.content: Select Proceed to Checkout . It's below the "Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas" heading.

steps.title: Select Proceed to Checkout.
steps.content: Select Proceed to Checkout . This is at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Select a payment method.
steps.content: Select a payment method. In the list of payment methods at the top of the screen, highlight the one you want to use and press X . If you don't have a payment method set up, you'll need to add one before proceeding.

steps.title: Select Confirm Purchase.
steps.content: Select Confirm Purchase . It's on the right side of the screen. This will confirm your purchase and begin downloading Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas. Once GTA: SA finishes downloading, you can select it from your PlayStation 4's home page to play it.
